This set of DVDs has a ton of information packed into it. From the revolutionary war to current it covers the riflemen of the military.
A great history of the sniper from the revolutionary war to the present.  Lots of good information, current gear, techniques, etc.
These are some really neat programs about snipers. I really enjoyed watching them and will watch them again in the future.
I bought this for my husband as a gift. He is in law enforcement and is a trained sniper and was excited to watch this and at five dollars...what a deal.
I liked it.  It was a good buy.  I had seen most of it before.  I enjoyed it. I would likely buy again.
Good shows about snipers and sniper history - similar to other shows I have seen on Military channel but if you don't have Military channel this is a good buy - great price once again from Amazon.

This is great value for money,two DVD's covering the history and training of the U.S sniper,covers a timeline that starts with the Revolution right up to and including Iraq/Afghanistan,6 separate programs and 4.5 hours playing time... A bargain!
This isn't a movie like I thought.....It is a documentary from 1800's about snipers through today.....Good documentary though.....I don't recommend it movie wise.....

Amazing!  This dvd covers the history of the American sniper and snipers in general from the Revolutionary War to the present day wars.  The first disc discusses some of the training U.S. military snipers have to go through and the equipment they use.  They discuss their rifles, rifle and spotter scopes and how they make their ghillie suits.  The second disc is about the sniper in combat operatons from the 18th century to the 21st.  This dvd is the best out there for the topic of American snipers, their stories, equipment and training.  Also has some discussions on foreign snipers outside the U.S.A.  With OPSEC in mind it won't give out all the secrets, but its still an amazing DVD on the topic of professional snipers.  Also, if you like this DVD then check out the books Ultimate Sniper (more of a manual) and Triggermen.  Both are very well written and very informative on the topics of snipers, shooting and some of their experiences in combat.

Good movie to watch 1 time but not much more than that. Acting was lackluster and  almost every line was borrowed from some lackluster movie that I have seen before. Not enough drama and completely  predictable. Hopefully the next movie in this series will be better.

Lots and lots and lots of information on here.  Plenty of history from the Civil War all the way to today's conflicts. I enjoyed all the information and the re-enactments on here.  4+ hours of viewing on two DVD's.

I admit to being somewhat puzzled after reading some of the reviews about this excellent DVD.  It is clearly a documentary on the history and training program of the American Sniper. This is a two DVD pack that runs 4 hours and 28 minutes. It is organized into six interesting programs.

Program one covers Who is the Sniper? This part deals with the personality of the sniper, sniper training and  their equipment. The second program tells about The sniper at war. The missions, first kill and confirmed kills are explained in this section. The third program covers how snipers were used in the revolutionary war to the Mexican American war. The fourth program deals with the use of snipers from the civil war to WW11. The fifth program explains how snipers were used in the Korean war, the Vietnam war and the police wars. The final program covers the American sniper in the 21st century.  This section includes information on the law enforcement sniper, snipers in the Iraq and Afghanistan wars and the many myths and misconceptions about snipers.

In conclusion, this excellent two-DVD set is a real bargain.  If you are interested in learning the vital role the sniper plays in the battle to defeat our enemies, you should check out this DVD. A highly informative DVD.

Rating:  4 Stars.  Joseph J. Truncale  (Author: The Samurai Soul: An old warrior's poetic tribute)
